intro: Lasiocephalus yacuanquensis, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green, adapted to withstand harsh mountain climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
